H0.text: Types of fronts are what meteorologists should know about when they study weather.

H1.text: Types of fossils are what meteorologists should know about when studying weather.

H2.text: Types of circuits are something meteorologists should know about when studying weather.

H3.text: Types of adaptations are what meteorologists should know about when studying weather.

A4.text: Fronts are the principal cause of significant weather.

A5.text: Cold fronts can produce sharper and more intense changes in weather and move at a rate that is up to twice as fast as warm fronts.
